The reception staff were consistently friendly and helpful when asking for directions etc. All was well until we were ready to leave for the airport when the shuttle bus we had booked drove off 10 minutes early – without us! On checking, we were told that the driver had to go for his lunch, although we had been told what times were available, and our booking time was there in the diary for all to see. Still, they put it right immediately by calling us a cab and paying for it. Location-wise, I would not have called this hotel "downtown" since it was several blocks from the main hub of things. We didn't mind this as it made it quieter and we were happy to walk, but those who want to be in the centre should be aware of this. It is actually right on the outskirts of downtown and quite close to the freeway and quite hard to negotiate arrival if you don’t know the city because of all the confusing one-way systems. So, in short, a great hotel with lovely rooms and very nice staff, but don't go for the pool and don't choose if you don't like walking!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sos100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for CTIA Conference in San Diego. Good basic hotel. Free wireless, a kitchen that's not bad (they do a decent breakfast), and friendly and helpful staff. It's basic, and is being done - up. I liked it. Especially the price - which was cheap! 20 minute walk to the conference centre (and also Gaslamp area).

Reviews.Title: “Close to Gaslamp, Friendly, Quality & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: acota
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value and a very nicely updated Holiday Inn. We stayed 2 nights for a concert/ anniversary weekend. The room was on the 11th floor and we could see the bay and all the old ships. You can see the airport, but not hear the airport at all (or the nearby freeway) The rooms are modern, nicely decorated, comfy and roomy. The front desk was really helpful with giving us directions around town. This hotel is a short walk to the train station, little italy, the cruise ship terminals, trolly stations & gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: secretconsumer
Reviews.Content: Really nice granite countertops in the bathroom; love the setup in there. Roomy, spacious, and relaxing. Within walking distance of the Gaslamp district and Balboa Park. Is also literally next door to I-5 (yet there's not a lot of noise). Not fond of the hidden fee of around $2.30 for "marketing research." Don't get the parking permit for $14. There's a parking lot just down the street for $6 all day.

Reviews.Title: “A lousy visitation”
Reviews.Author: wolfsfire
Reviews.Content: We checked in, got to our room, and only one key out of three worked. The room, which was an "upgrade", was smaller than we anticipated, had no refrigerator, no microwave, and no luggage rack (we had to put our suitcase on the floor). Unlike other Holiday Inns, there was no formal restaurant and no bar...merely a fast food type area with beer and wine and limited seating...it was smaller than the breakfast area of any of the Holiday Inn Express locations at which we have stayed. A partner of ours, who also checked in when we did, found the room they gave her reeking with cigarette smoke even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room. We are Gold Priority Members which means that we stay in Holiday Inns frequently. This has been one of our worst experiences. There are other Holiday Inns nearby. We suggest you explore them. We have not checked them out ourselves, but we will not return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Remembers the Meaning of Customer Service! Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: katefromthelake
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Downtown San Deigo is a small, clean, comfortable hotel with a great staff! Everyone at this hotel from the manager of guest services, wonderful Jeremiah, to the cafe workers at the small but fantastically great breakfast cafe, to all the super shuttle drivers we drove crazy, I say congratulations on going the extra mile to serve your guests! Great location for business or pleasure, but the friendly smiles and caring attitude of all employees is the reason this hotel shines! This trip was the first trip for me and the third for my daughter who is relocating to San Diego. This is a great place,with great people, tell Jeremiah that the gals from Minnesota sent you!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimkip
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Holiday Inn Downtown very much. The rooms where remodeled very nicely with nice flat screen tv's and very nice beds. The bathrooms were very state of the art also. Very convienent to the freeway which is right outside the exit from the hotel parking lot. We did not hear any freeway nose at all which suprised me. I would recomend the hotel and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJ9847
Reviews.Content: Awful hotel with rude and unhelpful staff that don't listen to what your trying to tell them. I stayed in Holiday Inn for my trip to Comic Con 2009 with some friends. I had stayed in Holiday Inn on the Bay in 07' which was nicer apart from that they were renovating so it was noisy and our air con got busted. Still, they gave us a refund for the two nights we were dying from heat. Holiday Inn Downtown never gave us anything! The trouble started at check in when we had explained that we were all paying in cash and that it was two of us the first night, then other two were arriving a day later respectively. They insisted that we pay the full balance right there and then as they didn't just take cash as guests arrived. Our friend who booked the room said she had spoken to the hotel and that they had said it was fine for us to do that, and then the manager on duty tried to cover it by saying that she couldn't have spoken to anyone at reception at the hotel, when my friend most certainly did! It didn't get any better either, most of the restaurant staff didn't pay attention or understand when you ordered. My friend booked the shuttle for Tuesday morning to take her to the airport over the phone and they didn't take her name or room number so when she went down, no shuttle was there for her at the time she requested. Then she was told that the driver was on lunch break (at 8.30am!!) and when he/she went to tell the manager, he was "In the bathroom" but they offered a taxi instead, but then the shuttle turned up anyway. The only one good thing about the hotel was Steve, the evening shuttle bus driver who took us everywhere we wanted to go and picked us up and made us laugh and gave us great history lessons about San Diego. Maybe Steve can move to be a driver for Hard Rock hotel, because I'm staying there next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Last night, I didn't get to sleep at all, no, no, I lay awake and watched until the morning light...”
Reviews.Author: WAMarathoner
Reviews.Content: and, no, it wasn't because I was trying to "wash away the darkness of the lonely night" It was the damnable eco-friendly air conditioning at this hotel. It's apparently hooked up to a motion sensor. So every ten minutes or so, it noisily turned off until I would lament the heat, check to see why it was off, or cry out in frustration. No mention was made of the sensor until I complained upon checkout when the clerk sheepishly tried to explain it. If you sleep heavy or like it hot (SD was in the 90s), no problem. For most of us, having a machine noisily turn on and off several times an hour while trying to sleep is unacceptable. The room would get hot, I'd get up to see what was wrong, and it would turn on again after I touched the dial on the old a/c machine. Very inadequate, especially considering the stifling heat. About 6:30 a.m. I finally tried switching to "fan only", moving around the 90 degree air in the room. At least it was quiet and I got a *couple* of hours of sleep, sweaty as it was. The hallways are not air conditioned either, so you step out of your partially air conditioned room into a sauna. I didn't book an eco-tourism vacation in a yurt; I paid for a moderately priced hotel room with the amenities that entails. I don't feel that I got it. The positive reviews are probably from winter-time guests. According to their website: Public Space Data Services * High Speed Internet Access Service Provider: GTS * PC available Service Provider: GTS * Wireless Data Connection Initial Fee: $0.00 (USD) Service Provider: GTS Yet, Internet access was $5.99 for 15 minutes. I told the front desk that the website showed 0 for the Business Center, but she said it was contracted and couldn't do anything. Fortunately there was a USO within 6 blocks; otherwise, you're screwed. If you're going to the Civic Center, this is fairly close. It's too far to walk to the Convention Center, though. The trolley is about 6 blocks; the bus, 7. They have a shuttle (with a great driver) to/from the airport on the half hour. The room itself was very clean and well appointed, if a little small. We had a great city view. The bathroom was ample in size, with lovely decor. The only problem was the placement of the hall mirror with shoji-type doors. It offered very little privacy as your shadow/silhouette was reflected to anyone on the beds. The pool was old, but adequate. No spa, though. There is a small deli-style restaurant on-site. The staff we interacted with was pleasant. I would not recommend this hotel because of the terrible air conditioning. Paying for a hotel room to sleep in only to be kept awake all night to save a few pennies on the a/c is just wrong. Why not instead offer a discount to those people who LIKE to be hot or want the motion-sensor rather than making the stay miserable for everyone?

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise... Holiday Inn San Diego Downtown”
Reviews.Author: SanFranExplorer
Reviews.Content: I finished my week long business trip in LA and decided to spend two days in San Diego towards the end of May and what a pleasant surprise this hotel is! I agreed with some previous reviews about the location - this hotel is NOT really in the heart of downtown or so-called "Gaslamp District" but it is within a close walking distance. About two blocks away from the "Little Italy" area in town so it's very easy access to many restaurants and shops. AND, the premise has got a spectacular view of the San Diego Bay so it makes up all the difference (if you have a room facing the Bay) for those of you who wish to avoid all the downtown bustling and hustling. Exterior of hotel premise does look OLD and OUTDATED, but boy I was surprised when I walked into the room! Everything is new, fresh and modernized! Clea- line furnishing, big desk, LCD TV, renovated bathroom....pretty much everything you can ask for a nice business hotel - all for around $75 a day! Consider that's how much the 2-star (or even 1-star) hotels will charge you in a popular city like San Diego, you simply can not beat this price! The only drawback of the hotel is it does charge quite a bit money for guest parking on premise and you pretty much need to have a car for this location as the public transportation is not really close by. However, there is plenty of street parking around the hotel so do drive around and you will find FREE parking quite easily. Overall, I'll recommend this hotel for a quick trip, especially for business purpose. It would be totally worthwhile if you get a great deal! I will return in the future for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not your father's Holiday Inn - and that's good.”
Reviews.Author: hosaka
Reviews.Content: If this is what Holiday Inns have become since I was kid 30 years ago, I'm going to have to rethink my image of them. The Holiday Inns I remember staying at years ago weren't anywhere near as nice as this. I stayed in a room on the top (16th) floor, and I was surprised by how nice the room was. The decor felt modern, the views were great, and it was shockingly quiet, given how close it is to the 5 freeway (even the noise inside the halls was barely noticeable). Free internet worked just fine, nice selection of TV channels (sports, news, HBO, HD channels, etc.). It's a couple of blocks from Little Italy, which makes for a pleasant walk to lots of fantastic restaurants, but you'll probably want to cab to the major downtown venues like the convention center. Interactions with staff were few but all were good. No problems with check-in, check-out, or billing discrepancies. Didn't use the pool, business center, or fitness center, so can't comment on those. Warning: parking spaces are small (take your time when parking) and the restaurant downstairs is more like a cafe (plus it can be busy in the morning, so plan a few extra minutes during breakfast "rush hour").

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully pleasant”
Reviews.Author: MellowKali
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here, especially the bathrooms! I'm a real stickler for the bathrooms so when I saw the vanity mirror, fierce blowdryer, I was definitely happy. The food was pretty good, too! The elevators were fast & efficient & the staff was beyond friendly & courteous. It was great hearing a "good morning" from the desk or a manager walking by. Thanks for making my stay so wonderfully pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMills
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with a great staff and location. Our room had a fantastic view of downtown and the water. The room was good sized and the bathroom was very clean and spacious. Best of all their prices were reasonable. My wife and I have stayed at three other hotels in San Diego near the waterfront but the Downtown Holiday Inn was the best place we've stayed and had much better service. We felt like we got a lot of extras and got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: FussyArizona
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the "tower" and had a very nice room...lots of nice touches. The room was very well insulated and very quiet. I had dinner at the Point Loma cafe next to the hotel and it was delicious. The only negative was too few parking spots. Great view of the harbor and easy access to downtown and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Way too small for a family”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaCountryGirl
Reviews.Content: lacks drawer space, maid knocked in spite of Do Not Disturb, dirty shower curtain, TINY pool, pay to park, pay to use lobby computers, restaurant tiny & expensive, esp. for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Suited Our Needs Well”
Reviews.Author: superstaribe
Reviews.Content: So I read through the reviews, and have to say I was quite pleased with the hotel. We came to San Diego to enjoy the Zoo, downtown area and Hillcrest. Our intentions were not to stay in a hotel, locked up in a room or a lobby! So to those of you who have written that their lobby is small....I think it was cute! Our trip was planned - as my partner plans everything from the moment we wake up to the moment we go to bed! We got up had breakfast-which we thought was good and at a resonable price. Come to New Orleans if ya'll want overpriced -touristy stuff. Took the shuttle to the Zoo/Balboa Park area. Very nice! If you haven't been to the zoo, take the double decked bus first. It takes you all over the zoo, then you can go back to only the places you like. We loved the pandas. Then we went back to the hotel, changed and walked over to this area called "Little Italy". We had dinner at a great restaurant- again- very resonable prices. Then it was off to the hotel to rest for the next day. The second day, we awoke and went to breakfast. There was a lot of people, and we had to wait a tad, but it was fine. The General Manager bought us a couple cups of coffee whie we waited. He is a ragin cajun as well- from the bayous. Actually, I am from Kansas, but my partner is from Louisiana. The manager mentioned that they had completed a renovation. It looks like it, as it is very nice. We were then off to downtown. The shuttle dropped us off near the cruise ships, since we were going on the Hornblower. We spent the day on the ocean, then at the USS Midway and ate at Anthony's Fish grotto. Not so great! Anyway, back to the hotel (I forgot what I was reviewing). As i stated before, we slept in the hotel, but spent most of the days on the go. We liked the rooms and the staff- very nice! The shuttle drivers Cory and Eric were extremely nice and helpful. I liked the free wireless internet, or at least my partner did. That is all he did was plan the next day via the computer. The bathrooms had a make up mirror- I have never seen that at a hotel before. And the decor was more like a Westin. Just not the same price. If we go back to San Diego, I would stay again. It was a great price, really nice staff and very comfortable. I probably wouldn't rent a car, like we did. Their shuttle takes you almost anywhere. Plus I could have saved the $14 per night charge.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star hotel with 3.5 Star rooms”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit far from the typical Convention type activities in downtown SD. However, I like to walk and ended out walking the 15-20 minute trek down to the Convention Center several times. For the average person, this would not be a practical walk. And honestly, at nite, I did not feel 100% safe walking back. Pros: *Staff was very friendly and helpful with directions and info on the area. *The rooms clearly have been well-updated and are quite comfy. It feels more like a hilton /sheraton/ marriott (Just the room though). *The price is inexpensive! Cons: *To pay that much for parking at the very edge of downtown SD is silly. And the parking is nauseating, since the building is a circle!!! If you get there after 6 on Saturdays or anytime Sundays, try to save yourself $22, and park on the streets for that day! *There is virtually NO lobby! it is super small. A hotel that is 3 stars typically has a comfortable lobby with ample space to sit, converse and grab a drink and dinner, or to sit on a couch and talk to friends or make phone calls. This was not practical at the holiday inn. The lobby was about 1/3 or 1/4 the size of a typical limited service hotel such as courtyard inn or hampton inn. I am not sure why this is not a holiday inn express. *The restaurant is inexpensive however it is VERY embarrassing. Never at a 3 star type hotel (or a hotel that proclaims to be a full-service hotel) have I ever seen the main restaurant resemble a luncheonette. It was very embarrassing. However as ludicrous as it was, the people working there were very cordial. *The rooms are very small for a hotel in a small-medium sized city. *Pool is pathetic. Treat this as a Holiday Inn Express with a room similar to a 3.5 star hotel. If you are a walker, then this could be used as a great bargain spot while in SD, otherwise it is too far outta the main hub of activity.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: jcarl11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to all the major attractions. It was convenient to airport but not close enough to hear the planes. The rooms looked like some of the really expensive hotels I have stayed in before. I had and excellent view of the water from my room. The dinning within walking distance was exceptional. We also liked how accommodating the shuttle guy and reception staff was to us. It was a vacation that I will remember forever and I would go back to this hotel any day!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: bigfitz79
Reviews.Content: Nice place, and the walk to the Gaslamp Quarter wasn't bad at all. The room was very clean and may have been newly renovated, the smell in the room reminded me of a new RV at a camping expo. Nice view, clean, comfortable beds and pillows. Room service was available but I never did figure out if there was an actual restaurant or just the deli-style shop that I saw in the lobby. I was lucky in that I got a great price, but I definitely got my money's worth. Do note that parking costs an extra $14 per day, if I had to do everything over again I would probably have not picked up my rental car until the next morning in order to save some $$.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: kceesse
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Holiday Inn Downtown last weekend, and here are my reviews Pro - Renovated rooms (it is clear that rooms are renovated, as the bathrooms are very modern, beds are comfortable, and even plasma TV!) - Lots of towels in bathroom - Very modern looking bathroom - Good service - Clean decor - Cheap rates - Free internet Cons - Off-beat location: it is quite far away from the heart of SD such as the gaslamp district etc - Very tiny lobby and not very modern - Low ceiling height That is pretty much it - It is a relatively modern Holiday Inn that was renovated - so don't be deterred by TripAdvisor rating. I know it is rated pretty low - but the rooms do look renovated and are quite new. One huge con is the off-beat location. There are tons of hotels (abeit more expensive) located near the more touristy districts.

Reviews.Title: “great renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: skaistda
Reviews.Content: We, like most others, got a great deal on priceline for this hotel and it was totally worth the money. The hotel is in downtown san diego, but a bit far from the gaslamp quarter and the actual "downtown" area most people talk about. Either way, little italy is VERY close and the walk to gaslamp only took about 20 minutes. The hotel is totally newly renovated with HD TVs, granite countertops, great big beds and comfortable furnishing. The parking fee is pretty lame, about $14/night, but you can easily park across the street on 2nd ave, right off of the freeway to avoid that. The restaurant was like something you'd see at an airport, a weird little cafe type thing, but there are plenty of great cheap places nearby, so it wasn't too bad. This was a great stay, and totally worth the money, especially since priceline made it so cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, Courteous staff, clean, comfortable, great location for the airport!”
Reviews.Author: Kindergirl145
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night and were pleasantly surprised. We had secured the room through Priceline at a very discounted rate, and based on certain reviews were a bit cautious as to what we would find. We arrived late in the evening after a very long flight, and the staff was extremely accommodating and very friendly . I had taken the advice of a reviewer and requested a room on a higher floor with a water view, and received a room on the 12th floor with a view of the bay and partial city views. It was beautiful, and very quiet. The hotel is located next to an interstate, but I don't know if noise is a problem since we were on the opposite side away from the road. The room was very clean, with a very comfortable king-size bed - and we could request firmer or softer pillows if we disliked the ones already in place. The bathroom had granite counter tops, with the usual amenities. The room had a flat screen TV and free internet (always a plus!). Since we had only booked for one night, we had no need for an in-room refrigerator, which would have been convenient had we planned on a longer stay. Parking fees are high - I think $17.00 - but we waited until the next morning to pick up our rental car. We chose not to avail ourselves of the restaurant for breakfast and instead walked to the HobNob restaurant about eight blocks north of the hotel, where we enjoyed a delicious meal. The hotel is very convenient to the airport and close to Little Italy. We have traveled extensively and based on the price and our purposes, we were quite pleased with the Holiday Inn San Diego- Downtown. We would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Looking Holiday Inn I have stayed with”
Reviews.Author: Beachlovingboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed the last week of February and was highly impressed with the rooms and the service. I have stayed with Holiday Inn for the last 10 years and have not seen such an impressive, rich looking room. My friends joked me about booking rooms at a Holiday Inn, but once we got here, I looked like a hero! Restaurant served good food; however, the size was a little small. The staff seemed to really like working there and went above and beyond when we needed directions to Seaworld and the Gas Lamp area. Little Italy is a great place and within walking distance. Definitely plan to stay there again in July, for a wedding.

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAX-PHL
Reviews.Content: I think if one has high expectations of this hotel, he/she will be disappointed. I got this hotel through Priceline and feel got my money's worth (definitely not if I had to pay even the discounted rate on its website). The hotel is in a decent location (despite it being called "downtown") if you have a car. Otherwise, it's long walks to "nearby" attractions (ie: gaslamp district). Parking is a bit expensive given its location, but there is a way around it (no, not sneaking in!). The room is clean with a nice flat screen TV. Overall, it's not a bad place to stay if all you are looking for is a clean room in a decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money on this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kellysha
Reviews.Content: Okay so it is a holiday inn. but still the communication was awful at this hotel. i arrive there on valentines day weekend. I find out that i have to pay 17$ for parking, Then pay 100$ for a deposit. Um. okay. we were going to use that cash for our nightlife..... then the restaurant they promoted on line, was disgusting. It was a cafeteria. No room service, only a kids breakfast or something strange like that. But come on my lover and I were looking for more than that. Now, I asked if they had a shuttle that went from our hotel to the gaslamp district. They say with enthusiasm that They do have a shuttle that will take us to wherever we want to go downtown, they say, but please come down in 20 min. (understandable) This didn't happen. It was an airport shuttle. So they wanted US to waste our time, and ride around with people getting dropped off at the airport, and when its convient for them, then they can drop us off. HELLNO. Just tell us to get a cab. There manipulation was pathetic. Anytime i see a Holiday Inn, I seriously gag. I really disliked my stay here and i will never ever advise someone to book there room there, nor will I ever will. Good luck to the staff and people who stay there. god bless. -Kelly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Bad Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Mariposa1020
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three days and would definately return. The staff is very friendly and offer complimentary shuttle service anywhere in the downtown area. The lobby is small but modern, the rooms were spacious an well decorated. The only bad thing I can say about this hotel is the restaurant. It is a small cafe and they do not know what they are doing. We ate a few meals here for the sheer convenience but each time our order was wrong and part or all the food was cold, and service was slow. I asked the Front Desk Staff and they said that the turn over is quite high in the cafe so perhaps that is why it is not well run. I would stay here again but skip the restaurant/cafe.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was nice but no refrigerator in the room for the price??!?!?!?”
Reviews.Author: drivas01
Reviews.Content: I could not believe how nice this room was and it did not have a refrigerator!!! Insane.....and for the price we paid. Other than than, it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: AceOutlaw
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were in San Diego from 01/01/09 to 01/04/09. We usually try Priceline for getaways and this hotel was the one selected for our price ($65 US per night). The rooms were nice and clean. The bed was comfortable. The staff was very friendly. There are other hotels closer to the port. This is within walking distance though several blocks from there. We got tired of walking sometimes and the shuttles were very helpful. My only complaint was the restaurant. It was pretty basic and overpriced even for a hotel. I really appreciated the shuttle. The drivers Steve and Corey didn't keep us waiting whenever we needed a ride. We not only got rides to and from the airport but to places in the downtown area. No hassles. We had a good time down by the port doing excursions, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Room stinks, it is noisy, staff unfrienldy. Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: fairness_8
Reviews.Content: This place is a disgustingly priced accommodation. It has certainly changed my views on Holiday inns. The room absolutely stinks! I cannot describe the smell of that place, but to be honest the clothes that I mistakenly left out of my suitcase, stank like the place. It was unbelievable! Thin walls so you can hear everything, air conditioning really loud, fire engines passing close by throughout the night, bathroom really in need of renovation. It was an awful experience. I do no recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly...free shuttle!!”
Reviews.Author: Downtown48
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. We came in the night before a cruise out of San Diego and arrived in town at about 10:00 PM. The free airport shuttle ran until 11:00 PM which was perfect! They picked us up and even offered to stop at a taco shop for some late night food to go. We were planning on taking a cab to the cruise terminal the next day but the shuttle driver told us to tell the front desk when we wanted to the dock and they would arrange for the shuttle to take us down...again for free! Another couple an my wife headed to the the ship and we stopped at the Amtrak station to drop them off and we were at the ship within 5 minutes! The hotel itself was very clean and had a huge, comfortable bed. They even had something like 5 different styles of pillows you could order depending on how soft or firm you wanted them. We walked to a nice breakfast place and I walked to a bank in the morning. There was a gas station accross the street for snacks and a liquor store/deli two blocks away. We didn't hear the freeway noise at all but we were on the opposite side of the building. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again the night before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dknighto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very central location for anything in San Diego. It is only six blocks west to the Trolley stop and two more blocks to the pier. It is approximately the same distance south to Horton Plaza. It is only about 4 blocks to Little Italy. The interesting aspect is this hotel is round, which makes it very easy to find your room. You won't get lost going down the wrong hallway. The bed was very comfortable and I was surprised since it is so close to the freeway that I didn't hear any traffic noises. They have a little cafe that is a little pricey on their lunch and dinner menus but was very reasonable and convenient for breakfast. I have stayed at a couple of motels and a couple of other hotels in the same area of San Diego and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise at the Holiday Inn Downtown (Harbor View)”
Reviews.Author: Louisville40204
Reviews.Content: Must admit that I am typically NOT a Holiday Inn fan and consider the chain to be near the bottom of my preference list of hotel chains. However, this property is a definite exception to the typical Holiday Inn. This property has been recently renovated, complete with total carpet replacement in guest rooms and public spaces. In addition, the bathrooms in each room have been totally remodeled, as the flooring has been replaced. The bedding has more of a Sheraton look and feel with white duvets and very nice selection of pillows and quality sheets. There is even a card on the bed that states that if the pillows on your bed do not satisfy you, please call and request other types that are listed on the pillow selection card. Wow, who would ever expect such an option at a Holiday Inn? The carpeting is very nice and NEW, with a double ring style pattern on a dark green background. Once again, very nice quality of carpeting. I had to keep reminding myself I was in a Holiday Inn and not a Sheraton. It really did have a Sheraton feel. Just be sure to request a high floor location for your room, as the property is located overlooking Interstate 5 of downtown. I was on the 15th floor and heard nothing from the street.. Obviously, the access to major roadways and downtown is outstanding at this property and parking, although it comes with a fee, is quite convenient in an attached garage. The staff was excellent in each instance that I dealt with them and were very genuine in their desire to please with any requests made. I especially found Ryan at the front desk to be committed to customer service, as he typically went above and beyond what I would expect when dealing with the public at large of a hotel. This hotel definitely deserves a try on your next visit to San Diego! It is in the center of most attractions. It is <10 minutes from the beaches, malls, Sea World, and the San Diego Zoo. You cannot beat its central location while in San Diego. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Staff are great... The hotel not so great.”
Reviews.Author: CoronaBoy
Reviews.Content: I checked in on July 18th. The hotel staff were very nice and I was able to get an early check in which was a bonus. The hotel is located by the freeway and is a bit tricky to find but I guess the location is not their fault. The hotel lobby is very small and looks old. The room was o.k, I asked for extra pillows and was provided right away. My concerns with the stay were that there are no fridges or microwaves int the rooms. They charge you for all phone calls, including local calls, parking is also $12/day... There was no hair dryer in the room and the internet was not working. I had paid for a bayview room but was given a room facing the city. My other problem was that this hotel is not really downtown. Its about a 20 minute walk to the entertainment district and there is nothing within walking distance. So if you're looking for something close to the entertainment area I would not recommend this hotel. Overall I would not stay at this hotel again unless they charged considerably less. I paid $180 for the night and the hotel was not worth more and $100 in my opinion. I hope that these problems were just my bad luck. The staff are real nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Fee Outrageous; Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: michaelwyeth
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline and thought I got a good deal. My wife and I have a 5 yr old and 7 yr old and wanted to take him to the zoo and we really wanted double beds. However, the receptionist said that none were availabe and we ended up in this tiny room with only one bed and to top it all off it faced the freeway. It seems that the receptionist deliberately gave us the worst room possible since it says priceline on the reservation. They also charge an arm and a leg for parking and they don't even validate the parking even though you are staying at their hotel . . . what, do they think you got there by foot? Some of the receptionists you can barely understand (I think they are Indian) and they are very impolite . . . I guess they don't know how to smile or at least pretend. Anyway, I felt like a 3rd class guest at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Major reconstruction”
Reviews.Author: FLKaman
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a convienient location which makes it easy to get around town. They do charge for parking($6-12) per night. The rooms are smallish but well kept. They are in the midst of a major renovation, so it can be quite noisy during the day. We stayed on the 11th floor, but could still hear the work going on. If you like to sleep late, this may not be your best choice. If you're up and out early, this is a fine location with a very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: plumblevel
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for one night. Nice downtown location. Close to bay, close to good restaurants, close to interstate, close to airport and car rentals. Older hotel but staff was very helpful and room was nice and clean with a good downtown view. The price we paid through priceline was very fair and considering that it was an awesome value. The only negative for the hotel is the 12 dollar charge for parking in their own lot that is connected to the hotel. One is unaware of this charge when using priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Can't sleep at Holiday Inn Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Zmel110
Reviews.Content: I am writing from my hotel room. i can barely concentrate or sleep due to the very loud freeway noise. I am a business traveller and this is my second time staying here. The first time I stayed at the upper levels and not facing the freeway and there was not much of a problem. This time I am on the fourth floor and the noise is absolutely ridiculous. I asked the staff if I could change my room and without even trying to locate another room they said NO! They are advertising their custom pillows that I thought I would be entitled to and one hour a go they said they will bring one up in a few minutes. I got a very nice sincere letter from the hotel manager asking me to bring any issues up to her attention, which sounds nice. But even when I called for a wake up call they seemed annoyed. Otherwise, the room is pretty modest and small. I am paying $139/day, which is not bad but I rather pay another $100/day and get a good night sleep at the W!! Big mistake!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Affordable Clean Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ols1784
Reviews.Content: We received a $99 a night special from travelzoo and were a little cautious when reading some of the reviews on here. However, I must say that our room was very clean and modern and the staff was excellent. It is conveniently located in the middle of all the major downtown San Diego attractions and the shuttle bus will take you wherever you want to go..even if your the only 2 who want to go somewhere. Yes the hotel is right next to a freeway and you hear noise from the outside...but nothing comes through the room. If you are looking for a hotel with a big pool and lots of amenities this is not the one for you. But if you are planning a short stay on a 23 year olds budget I truly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: tacsmom
Reviews.Content: I am a very frequent Priceline user and have had great luck over the years, but this was by far our worst experience. Two ashtrays were on either side of the entry into the lobby, and the entire hotel smelled of smoke. I felt like I was in an old Las Vegas casino. The room was a smoking room ( a risk you take with Priceline) and there were cigarette burns all over the place. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall in several spots. There were water stains on the ceiling. The room was very small and the bathroom even smaller. Our beds were smaller than my son's full size bed. While the location is a short walk to downtown and Little Italy, the hotel is essentially sandwiched between and freeway and a freeway ramp. The pool was small, dirty, and in disrepair. No hot tub. The staff were unwilling to give us another room, and were very rude when we checked out the next morning. They didn't even ask how our stay was - guess they knew the answer already.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn for a mini holiday escape...”
Reviews.Author: sandiegotonio
Reviews.Content: I usually don't hold my breath when I book a room on Priceline..I already know what to expect...at least I did...for some strange reason, the hotels we score usually give us the crappy, "nobody wants" rooms....but I was surprised with this Holiday Inn...it was my birthday and I wanted to get out of town for a day, so I booked this room thinking I would end up sleeping in a broom closet. But I was happy to find out I was on the 10th floor, in a clean, non smoking room with a semi-great view of the harbor. And yes, the bathroom is small and the toilet area even smaller ((why no fans in bathrooms anymore??) but the size and comfort of the bed and speedy room service made up for it. I enjoyed myself here so much that i stayed an extra day. The FREE high speed internet was a great surprise.....I was "borrowing" Radissons WiFi from across the street until i realized that the high speed in my room was free... Room service is crazy though for charging $12 bucks for an omelet then gently topping it off with an 18% gratuity, $2 room charge and taxes...that $12 omelet ended up costing us $25....its better to just get your super sized, relaxed butt out of bed and down to the coffeeshop a few blocks away for a bagel.... The parking is insane with their $12 a day parking fee..but I was able to find parking on both days on the street. I actually didn't even need the car...Downtown is less than a 10 minute walk..Little Italy 4 minute and the harbor less than 5......

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: noke12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night while on a business trip the week of July 4th. I stayed at the Wyndam - Emerald Plaza (company paid for it) the first 6 days and the Holiday Inn Harbor View the last night. I pricelined it for $86, which was a good deal during that week. I actually liked this hotel more than the Emerald Plaza. First, it was nearly just as nice in the rooms. The lobby lacks the luxury of the wyndam, but who really hangs out in the lobby. Second, FREE internet! 15 dollars a day at the wyndam adds up and is inconvient. So I was happy about that. They were also flexible about choosing the type of room, king bed, etc even though i bought it on priceline. This hotel is a nice, and near the trolley line for easy access to mexico or anywhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “It's the worst i ever been to in San Diego area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so bad. Probably it was a good hotel 20 years ago, but now it's so filthy and cheap. The location is good but that's all you'll get staying in this hotel. It needs to get carpets changed, change bed clothings, vacuum, it is just so old and smelly. I'll never stay in this hotel again and this gives me a terrible image of what Holiday Inn has become. It's a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of $12 a day parking fee”
Reviews.Author: KrisNAz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, traffic is bad though so be careful if you plan on walking across the street. I think this is the Holiday Inn (circular shaped) a few blocks from the Gas Lamp district that we stayed in. They charged us $12 a day to park!! They justified it saying the land is owned by San Diego county and it's actually the city's charge, or something to that effect. On top of of the other charges and taxes we had to pay, didnt turn out to be that great of a deal. Elevators take forever since theyre always crowded. The rooms were decent and fairly comfortable, alot of noise from the outside though. Probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, good value, well located”
Reviews.Author: MXLondon
Reviews.Content: Good value Holiday Inn close to Little Italy and an easy (10-minute) walk to Downtown. Clean, spacious, comfortable rooms. Shuttle bus available to and from airport, zoo etc. Friendly, courteous staff. Restaurant small and limited choice of food, but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Basic”
Reviews.Author: MBNick
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at this Holiday Inn. The bad things? Restaurant not up to size of hotel. More like a small coffee shop. No bar. Interent service in the lobby is the pits. No spa at pool. Little off the beaten path for walking to to things. Rooms not big, closet storage barely enough for one person for a week. The good things? The staff are all helpful and responsive. The food is basic but good and they work hard with what they have. Place is fairly clean. They will even try to shuttle you around when they are not on airport runs which is good since Yellow Cab does not bother to show up 1/2 the time. If you are on business and need a place to sleep this is a good choice. Ask for an upper floor with a view of the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “There is a Reason it's Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: NatTaggart
Reviews.Content: Everyone calls this a great value, it is because they have been working on the elevators for several months. You will be forced to walk through a maze of utility rooms to access the freight elevator. With the elevators out of service they are always packed and sometimes you have to wait a few cycles, plan extra time. Furthermore, the hotel does not serve double Gin and Tonics. For a cheap place very close to downtown, it's one of the better ones. Just plan for some aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: bebe624
Reviews.Content: I am giving this hotel 4 stars not for the accomodations but for the service. We booked our room on hotwire and got this room for a great price. My husband was not excited to find out we would be staying at the Holiday Inn but it was a done deal. When we got there they had upgraded our room so we got a nice big room with a nice view. They even had internet service in the room for FREE! That was an extra bonus. The shuttle driver was really cool and took us downtown and was super helpful. It's not the Ritz, but for the price I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst nights..still remember it years later”
Reviews.Author: regalaone
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel one night 5 yrs ago. I still remember the night. Our party consisted of my 21 yr son, 22 yr old niece and myself. When booking the room we asked for a roll away as none of us were bedmates. We went out to dinner. Opened the rollaway around 11 pm. It stunk of smoke!!! Soon the odor filled the room. No one could any of us sleep on it. Called the front desk, they did send up another one...even smellier. Turns out (we figured this out, no one admitted this), all their help went into the room where the roll aways were stored to smoke. They obviously knew this. Even though we had gotten a no smoking room, this became a joke. We ended up putting this roll away out the door asap, and jerryrigged a rather uncomfortable sleeping arrangement. I complained in the morning but the staff could have cared less. Did absolutely nothing to try to fix the problem, either the night when I was complaining or during the morning check out process. I wrote a complaint form (the form that always seems to be in rooms these days) and to this day I've not gotten any reaction from the hotel or the chain. I've stayed in hundreds of hotels in my life, either for business or pleasure, and this was one of my most unsatisfying experiences. And the price for the room was (in 1999 $$) almost $200. Certainly NOT the place to stay in San Diego, where the choice of hotels is almost unlimited.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel on Hotwire.com and although we got lucky with our room, normally the hotel puts people that pay the discount rates in the lesser rooms. I know this because I called ahead to reserve a harbor view and king bed and was told that at my rate the best they could do was give me a city view. Once I arrived though I was able to get the harbor view but with two double beds. So be warned. It is right on the 5 freeway and if you are on that side, I could tell that it would be very noisy. We were in a room looking at the harbor on the 9th floor and could still hear the freeway traffic. The room itself was very clean and for a 3 star hotel had everything we needed. The beds were comfortable. They did charge us 10.00 per night to park which I thought was unfair considering we were staying in the hotel. Where else would we park? But over all at 54.00 a night it was a very good value for the money, and as long as I was able to stay on the harbor side of the hotel, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but---”
Reviews.Author: olaydt
Reviews.Content: Having just come in from a cruise we were hoping the hotel had a view of the bay but all we had was a view of the freeway. However, the room was clean, neat and cool and the beds comfortable. We walked to the Seaport Village which is quite a hike but we knew it before we undertook the walk. Stopped at Ralph's (groc store in downtown area) where we bought some goodies to eat the next morning because the small dining area within the complex wouldn't be open til 6 am and we had to go to airport by 5:15 am. Since our price for the hotel was good from Priceline we just can't complain too much but would much rather have been in Holiday Inn By the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid you can't beat this hotel. We got a room for $61 from Hotwire for Labor Day weekend. Hotel is nothing special, and our view was of the highway not the harbor. But overall the rooms and the hotel were clean. The staff was nice and the courtesy shuttle took us to Old Town, Sea World and to and from the Airport (they will also drive you to other local areas). I recommend you verify with the shuttle driver as to where exactly they will pick you up. We were also able to walk to the city trolley from the hotel. I would be sorely disappointed if I paid $150 which is what Expedia was offering for this hotel for the same dates of our stay. But if you can get a discount rate I recommend this place. I also agree that Troy the shuttle driver manager is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience despite other reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived 7:30pm Monday and the Hotel was full. My family of 5 with 3 small kids wanted 2 dbl beds, but nothing was available. Desk was very understanding and gave us a handicap room on the 14th floor with a view of the harbor and city - only 1 dbl bed but spacious room to accomodate 2 roll beds, comped the parking, and gave us 3 free meals for the kids. Desk person immediately delivered the roll beds to our room, personally and provided extra pillows. Desk person offered to give us 2 dbl bed room the next night with a view. Room was very clean, and we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: AVOID THIS HOTEL - Our room was burglarised while we went to Mexico for the day. Following all warnings for Mexico we left many valuables behind in the room that day, in a hidden place in the room with the PRIVACY PLEASE sign on the door. Despite this, the lock report for our room recorded a holiday inn staff member entering our room. Upon informing the staff we were burglarised, they simply didn't care and were very blaze about it. Their staff were either directly responsible for the theft or let someone in the room to burglarise it. Despite records of their staff unnecessarily entering our room the Holiday Inn Management refused to take any responsibility and we were not compensated for any of our losses. The holiday inn staff and chain management were very unsympathetic and unprofessional - this matter was never resolved as they simply stopped all correspondence with me. AVOID THIS PARTICULAR HOTEL LIKE THE PLAGUE and the Holiday Inn in general - they are pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you love hassles and walking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel that I have ever personally stayed in. The staff were rude, ignorant, and unfriendly. The only worthwhile thing at all was the shuttle driver Troy, who went out of his way to accomodate us and make up for all the hassles that we had to deal with. The other drivers would demand large tips, and then refuse to take us after we paid them, because they had to make "an airport run". Or, better yet, when we called the desk for a shuttle pick-up, the staff would never be able to 'locate' the drivers, and tell us to "just take a taxi" all the time. Harbor View??? Give me a break. Only if California renaimed the I-5 to the Harbor freeway, because you certainly have a great view of that. If Holiday Inn called me and offered me $1000.00 a night to stay here again, there is no way on god's green earth I ever would. Especially with the Embarcadero right around the corner. I had an awesome vacation with my fiance, as long as you took out anything to do with this horrible hotel minus that one exception. Thanks for trying Troy. Here's hoping that you get to a decent hotel real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: mikeyc8
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers excellent value (we got it from Hotwire for $51), good central location, clean rooms, and the breakfasts in the restaurant were actually pretty good. Try not to get a room facing the freeway on the north side, the south side is fairly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but there are probably more interesting locations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Standard Holiday Inn fare. The hotel overlooks the bay, but also a large multi-lane highway. Clean large room. Plus was that it was possible to walk to the gaslight district

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back, nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfiend and I really enjoyed this hotel. The room was clean, modern and the view from our window was beautiful. We live in San Diego only due to our personal lives, I have teens and my boyfriend's home is being renovated, we occasionally stay at hotels in San Diego. We have plans to stay at the Holdiay Inn again in a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go to the Holiday Inn- Harbor View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My review of the Holiday Inn- Phone charge of 0.75 per call, Local No Jacuzzi Tiny Pool Fitness Room in a closet Walked all night in down town San Diego- Why? Shuttle not available Could hear the ice machine all night Found used underwear in my drawer Rude staff

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We live in the Inland Empire and love to come to San Diego for some sun and fun. This hotel always makes our family trips such a joy. I suggest this hotel for anyone who visits San Diego.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn San Diego-Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1617 First Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101
